Author: jl777c#5810
Content: well this level of metadata was mostly deducible from tx size before sapling

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: knowing that a pool sent out payments identifies that tx as a pool payment

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: ok, so?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: there are no destination addresses on the blockchain

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: just a bunch of encypted data

Author: mrlynch#5735
Content: tx's are safu

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: since you cant know the amount used for inputs or know the total amount sent, does it really matter if you know that there were N inputs and Y outputs?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: certainly if you use a specific type of output, like 54 payments for a pool, then the information that the pool made a payment is known

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: but I think we kind of already knew that

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the important thing to remember is that the actual amounts are fully encrypted

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so is the source address

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so is the destination address

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: we can deduce that someone sent funds from some place to another place, using 3 inputs and 7 outputs

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: and the code will default to using 2 outputs as a standard, so most tx will have 2 outputs

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: in a way the number of inputs could leak a bit of info about the approx size

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: but people who merged their outputs would then convey false info

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: and if the standard merge is 10 inputs to 2 outputs, then it can be seen that somebody did a merge

Author: mrlynch#5735
Content: @jl777c sorry to hijack you, but... what's the komodo-cli command to see details based on opid? i'm trying to move funds from one zc address to another just to better track my mining proceeds and it's been a while since it's been in processing in agama

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: in any case, all this info was deducible before, it is just now visible in the rpc output

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: z_getoperationstatus
